abstract.p: Let p/q be a rational noninteger number with p > q ≥ 2. A real number λ > 0 is a <tex-math>$Z_{p/q} $</tex-math> -number if {λ(p/q)ⁿ} < 1/q for every nonnegative integer n, where {x} denotes the fractional part of x. We develop several algorithms to search for <tex-math>$Z_{p/q} $</tex-math> -numbers, and use them to determine lower bounds on such numbers for several p and q. It is shown, for instance, that if there is a <tex-math>$Z_{3/2} $</tex-math> -number, then it is greater than 2₄₇ . We also explore some connections between these problems and some questions regarding iterated maps on integers.
